seriesJson.title: Light unto my path
seriesJson.description: This series explores the books of the Old Testament, how they were written, how they were preserved, and why they continue to have influence.

node.title: The influence of the Bible
node.description: This program, the last in the series, looks at the ways that the Bible still resonates in modern society, even if it is sometimes not as well-known as before.

node.title: Psalms
node.description: This program focuses on the origins and characteristics of psalms.

node.title: Apocrypha
node.description: This program focuses on the Apocrypha, the Biblical books that had been "hidden away."

node.title: Wisdom of the Bible
node.description: This program focuses on the sayings of wisdom found in the Bible, including Proverbs.

node.title: The Bible as literature
node.description: This program looks at the Bible from its position as a piece of literature.

node.title: Literary prophets
node.description: This program focuses on literary prophets, those who wrote about their activities.

node.title: Ecclesiastes
node.description: This program focuses on Ecclesiastes, a canonical book of the Old Testament.

node.title: Jesus Christ and the Old Testament
node.description: This program explores the influence that the Old Testament had on Jesus Christ and his subsequent teachings.

node.title: The Bible
node.description: This program opens the series and discusses the Bible and its cultural and spiritual importance.

node.title: Rise of prophets
node.description: This program focuses on the mystery of prophecy and the rise of prophets.

node.title: Short stories in the Bible
node.description: This program focuses on how elements of the Bible can be broken down to be viewed as a collection of short stories.
